reviews.text: Positives : Helpful and friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere. Good quality service combined with a good level of interesting decor. Concierge helpful in getting local directions and info on local amenities. Negatives : None.
reviews.title: Our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a let down. You walk through the gleaming glass doors into this beautiful grand reception area. Then you walk through another set of double doors into the hallway with threadbare carpets and wonder what your room is going to be like!
reviews.title: Shame about the shabby rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well trust me it gets worse.
reviews.title: Desperate need of redecoration....

reviews.text: Our room: The carpets are stained, the furniture dated (80’s wood), there was dust everywhere. I put my handbag in the bottom of the bedside cabinet and when I pulled it out dust flew up in my face. The wooden bathroom door was chipped along the bottom. The bathroom had black condensation stains all over the ceiling. The grout by the shower was a brownish/black and the panel under the sink had dirty black marks across it. All in all it was very unpleasant.
reviews.title: Not the usual Hilton!

reviews.text: The Staff: The staff here are wonderful, very friendly and helpful and always smiling.
reviews.title: Wonder why Hilton Group allow them the name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: - location is good near a 24 hour Tesco
reviews.title: Hilton Centre Hotel, Newbury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - staff were all friendly and efficient
reviews.title: Tired needs a revamp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - checkin area and lounge area by the bar good
reviews.title: Hilton Hotel, Newbury Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - breakfast was ok
reviews.title: Not much for the buck

reviews.text: The Hilton Central is not really very central, it will be a long walk (1.5m) into the town but is convienient for Greenham Common, or the large out of town shopping center and 24hr Tesco! The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby, bar and resturaunt look impressive but go through the first double doors and the hotel shows it lack of investment. I was put into a disabled room without being asked so no bath or proper shower. The didn't have air conditioning and was very hot. Everything just felt a little shabby.
reviews.title: Time for a refurbishment of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite a sign for leisure facilities there are none. No gym or pool, they were decommisioned (if there was a pool) some years ago, but apparently you could use Hilton North Facilities (5 miles away) In fact next time I will because that's where I'll stay as its not less convienient, is more modern and has facilities.
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.text: Sink Blocked, toilet did not flush, really expensive bar prices (£7.00 for one small wine - extortion), toaster kept breaking, toast took 15 minutes at breakfast, no milk supplied for tea after request. Not expected from a Hilton. This is too many problems for an overnight stay
reviews.title: Stay at the Hilton Newbury
over booked
reviews.text: Hotel was very nice, reception staff helpful. Saw some other guests buying alcohol from outside the hotel and still enjoying in the Bar and no one noticed it was bit surprising. Breakfast service was not the best in terms of Welcoming and offering Tea & Coffee on time and other people who came after us were served before. One of the waiting staff totally ignored us when we tried to ask for Tea & Coffee.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was overbooked and they didnt have a family room for us, we ended up with a mattress on the floor for our daughter, (we had to make up the bed ourselves) Breakfast - we had to wait 15 mins for a table to be made up, we were not offered tea or coffee.. not the best stay. The slamming of doors woke my daughter up in the morning as they were quite loud.. The hotel itself is a nice hotel but not sure if we will return
reviews.title: In need of an update!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for the weekend in the hilton newbury centre, you walk in and the lobby is as you would expect a hilton to look, great to look at and the staff are excellent especially the f&B supervisor Karolina she is very friendly and very helpful, then you go to your room and its like if you were in a time warp and thrown back to the 1970 deco, but its grubby looking and the DIY repairs is terrible.
reviews.title: Hilton Newbury Centre

reviews.text: The room smells old the furniture looks old and unfortunately we were unable change rooms as the hotel was fully booked for the Newbury Races.
reviews.title: Good Weekend

reviews.text: The only good review to this Hilton is that the food in the restaurant is excellent and the staff are fantastic and very apologetic for the rooms. Hilton need to put alot of tlc and up date there rooms.
reviews.title: friendliest staff
no rooms for us
reviews.text: Overall we had a good weekend. Rooms were good. Some carpets require changing. breakfast was very good, plenty of choice. The bar prices were very expensive over nine pounds for a glass of cheap wine, very few guests using the bar.
The staff at the Hilton, Newbury Centre really made the stay! They were so friendly, helpful, efficient and caring as well as smartly dressed.
reviews.title: Never Again
